prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Overview** We will be creating a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a curved surface. The object has a rectangular base and a slightly tapered cylindrical body. The top and bottom surfaces are parallel to each other. **Part 1** *Shape*: Cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a curved surface. The object has a rectangular base and a slightly tapered cylindrical body. The top and bottom surfaces are parallel to each other. *Dimensions*: The length, width, and height of the object are 0.6612 units, 0.6612 units, and 0.1227 units respectively. *Procedure*: 1. Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles set to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector set to (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 2. Draw the first face of the sketch. It is a rectangle with two vertical lines and two horizontal lines. The two vertical lines are defined as: - Line 1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.4467, 0.0) - Line 4: Start Point (0.0, 0.4181), End Point (0.0, 0.0) The two horizontal lines are defined as: - Line 2: Start Point (0.4467, 0.0), End Point (0.4467, 0.1149) - Line 3: Start Point (0.0, 0.4181), End Point (0.4467, 0.4181) 3. Draw the second face of the sketch. It is an arc defined by three points: - Arc 1: Start Point (0.4467, 0.1149), Mid Point (0.2323, 0.2037), End Point (0.1435, 0.4181) 4. Draw the third face of the sketch. It is an arc defined by three points: - Arc 1: Start Point (0.1435, 0.4181), Mid Point (0.6612, 0.6326), End Point (0.4467, 0.1149) 5. Scale the sketch using the scaling factor of 0.6612. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector obtained from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal direction is 0.1227 units and the extrusion depth in the opposite direction of the normal is 0 units. The sketch scale factor used is 0.6612. The operation is to create a new solid body, without removing or adding any material to the preceding CAD models.</description>
